# ms-ex-lib

> A Kotlin library providing standardized application exception classes for microservices.

## Overview

ms-ex-lib defines a hierarchy of exception classes for handling different error categories in microservice applications: business logic errors, security/authentication errors, and system/infrastructure errors. All exceptions extend a base `ApplicationException` class that integrates with Spring's `HttpStatus` and provides structured error information.

## Repository Structure

- `/lib/src/main/kotlin/com/rubensgomes/msexlib/` - Main source code
  - `ApplicationException.kt` - Base exception class
  - `business/BusinessException.kt` - Business rule violations
  - `security/SecurityException.kt` - Authentication/authorization errors
  - `system/SystemException.kt` - Infrastructure/system errors
- `/lib/src/test/kotlin/` - Unit tests
- `/lib/build.gradle.kts` - Gradle build configuration (Kotlin DSL)
- `/settings.gradle.kts` - Project settings and version catalog

## Tech Stack

- Kotlin
- Java 25 (Amazon Corretto)
- Gradle 9.1.0 (Kotlin DSL)
- Spring Framework 6.2.x (HttpStatus)
- JUnit Jupiter 6.x (testing)
- Spotless with ktfmt (code formatting)

## Dependencies

This library depends on `ms-base-lib` which provides:
- `ApplicationError` interface - structured error details
- `ApplicationErrorCode` interface - error code with description
- `Status` enum - status indicators (SUCCESS, FAILURE, etc.)

## Exception Constructor Parameters

All exception classes require these parameters:
- `httpStatus: HttpStatus` - Must be 4xx or 5xx error status
- `status: Status` - Cannot be Status.SUCCESS
- `error: ApplicationError` - Structured error information
- `message: String` - Human-readable message (cannot be blank)
- `cause: Throwable?` - Optional underlying cause

## Build Commands

```
./gradlew :lib:spotlessApply  # Format code
./gradlew --info build        # Build and test
./gradlew --info test         # Run tests only
./gradlew --info clean        # Clean build artifacts
```
